raw_comment:
1) What do you notice? 
I noticed that students with parents that had a very high income rank had 7 times more of a chance to be admitted into elite colleges than those with parents that had low income ranks. 
2) What do you wonder?
I wonder if any background factors of these students' parents' jobs play a part in their admission as well. Does it matter what kind of job they have? 
3) How does this relate to you and your community?
This relates to me and my community because as a high schooler, we are preparing to enter college and pursue a career meaning people my age or older have to take in consideration of these details, we must be aware of our possibilities and take advantage of what we can. 
4) Whatâ€™s going on in this graph?
The Rich Take Over College Too?
ace_sentences: I noticed a difference in admission chances.
Some students have parents with a very high income rank.
Some students have parents with a low income rank.
A student with parents with a very high income rank has 7 times more chance to be admitted into an elite college than a student with parents with a low income rank.
I wonder about background factors of the parents' jobs.
I wonder if these background factors play a part in the admission of the students.
I wonder if the kind of job of a parent matters for the admission of the student.
I am a high school student.
My community includes high school students.
High school students prepare to enter college.
High school students prepare to pursue a career.
People of my age must take these details into consideration.
People of my age must be aware of their possibilities.
People of my age must take advantage of what they can.
The headline is: The Rich Take Over College Too?
